Standard: Zoé. To change direction, swipe sideways.
EN: Zoé. To change direction, swipe sideways.
DK: Zoé. For at ændre retning, swipe sidelæns.

Standard: If you want to jump, swipe upwards instead.
EN: If you want to jump, swipe upwards instead.
DK: Hvis du vil hoppe, så swipe opad i stedet.

Standard: You saw me touch this crystal, didn't you?
EN: You saw me touch this crystal, didn't you?
DK: Du så mig røre den her krystal, ikke?
Zoé. For at hoppe mellem afsatser-

Standard: I swipe any direction above me.. I know.
EN: I swipe any direction above me.. I know.
DK: Swiper jeg i en retning over mig. Det ved jeg.

Standard: Hello? You promised me an explanation! What's up with these crystals?
EN: Hello? You promised me an explanation! What's up with these crystals?
DK: Hallo? Du lovede mig en forklaring! Hvad sker der med de her krystaller?

Standard: Time. As it passes, so shall your life. And with it, the experiences of your former self coalesce into a crystal.
EN: Time. As it passes, so shall your life. And with it, the experiences of your former self coalesce into a crystal.
DK: Tid. Med dens passage, følger dit liv. Og med det, ville dit tidligere jegs erfaringer flyde sammen til en krystal

Standard: A crystal of pure experience, pure FLOW.
EN: A crystal of pure experience, pure FLOW.
DK: En krystal af ren erfaring, ren FLOW.

Standard: And as time passes. So does our friendship. You are now ready to face THE TOWER.
EN: And as time passes. So does our friendship. You are now ready to face THE TOWER.
DK: Og som tiden passere. Således vil vores venskab. Du er nu klar til møde TÅRNET.

Standard: But that makes no sense what about-
EN: But that makes no sense what about-
DK: Men det giver jo ingen mening, hvad med-

Standard: One parting gift of unsolicited advice.
EN: One parting gift of unsolicited advice.

Standard: Perchance one should not ignore the kind advice of strangers.
EN: Perchance one should not ignore the kind advice of strangers.
DK: Om muligt bør man undgå at ignorere en fremmeds godsindede ord.

Standard: Oh, a mysterious entity with a grudge. Great.
EN: Oh, a mysterious entity with a grudge. Great.
DK: Ah, en mystisk enhed som bærer nag. Fedt.

Standard: You have an attitude problem, miss.
EN: You have an attitude problem, miss.
DK: Du har et attitude problem, frøken.

Standard: Alright.. Weirdo voice.. I'll bite. What's with these crystals?
EN: Alright.. Weirdo voice.. I'll bite. What's with these crystals?
DK: Okay. Underlige stemme. Jeg bider. Hvad er der med de her krystaller?

Standard: I do not want to tell you anymore.
EN: I do not want to tell you anymore.
DK: Jeg har ikke længere lyst til at fortælle dig.

Standard: Only if I can teach you something.
EN: Only if I can teach you something.
DK: Kun hvis jeg kan lære dig noget.

Standard: I know you're talking to me. You don't need to be so mysterious.
EN: I know you're talking to me. You don't need to be so mysterious.
DK: Jeg ved du snakker til mig. Der er ingen grund til at opføre sig så mystisk.

Standard: Zoé. To roll under obstacles, swipe down.
EN: Zoé. To roll under obstacles, swipe down.
DK: Zoé. For at rulle under forhindringer, swipe ned.

Standard: Right. Very helpful. So. These crystals?
EN: Right. Very helpful. So. These crystals?
DK: Aha. Super hjælpsomt. Såeh. De her krystaller?

Standard: I.. Well.. We’re trying to catch you, remember?
EN: I.. Well.. We’re trying to catch you, remember?
DK: Jeg... Altså... Vi prøver at fange dig, du ved?

Standard: Yeah, and how do you think that’s going?
EN: Yeah, and how do you think that’s going?
DK: Ja, og hvordan synes du det går?

Standard: You’re the first to ask me.
EN: You’re the first to ask me.
DK: Du er den første som har spurgt mig.

Standard: I’ll take that as a yes. Bye!
EN: I’ll take that as a yes. Bye!
DK: Det tager jeg som et ja. Ses!

Standard: You know, for someone who fears the god-like status of this big chunk of metal, you sure are eager to follow me up here.
EN: You know, for someone who fears the god-like status of this big chunk of metal, you sure are eager to follow me up here.
DK: Du ved, som en der frygter den gudeagtige status den her kæmpe klump metal har, så er du meget ivrig efter at følge efter mig

Standard: He's old.. But he's got a lot of money.
EN: He's old.. But he's got a lot of money.
DK: Han er gammel... Men han har en masse penge.
Som om det betyder noget længere.

Standard: You still owe me an answer! Why are you-
EN: You still owe me an answer! Why are you-
DK: Du skylder mig stadig et svar! Hvorfor er du-

Standard: I don’t owe you anything! You keep following me!
EN: I don’t owe you anything! You keep following me!
DK: Jeg skylder dig ingenting! Du bliver ved med at følge efter mig!

Standard: If you want to stay down in that dump of a city and play cops and runners, be my guest. But you made it so far, so strap in and enjoy the sights or get out of my face!
EN: If you want to stay down in that dump of a city and play cops and runners, be my guest. But you made it so far, so strap in and enjoy the sights or get out of my face!
DK: Hvis du har lyst til at blive nede i det hul af en by og lege politi og løbere, så værsartig. Men du kom så langt, så spænd selen og nyd udsigten eller skrid!

Standard: Why did you run in here!? Trespassing the tower is punishable by ten years of hard labor!
EN: Why did you run in here!? Trespassing the tower is punishable by ten years of hard labor!
DK: Hvorfor løb du herind?! Indtrængelse af tårnet straffes med ti års tvungent arbejde!

Standard: How are you standing like that?
EN: How are you standing like that?
DK: Hvordan står du på den måde?

Standard: Ten years hard labor is pretty generous. No one has ever returned from the camps.
EN: Ten years hard labor is pretty generous. No one has ever returned from the camps.
DK: Ti års tvungent arbejde er ret gavmildt. Ingen er nogensinde vendt tilbage fra lejrene.

Standard: It’s only if you catch me. And you’re not exactly nailing it.
EN: It’s only if you catch me. And you’re not exactly nailing it.
DK: Kun hvis du fanger mig. Og det klarer du ligefrem så godt.

Standard: I really have to get going. Bye.
EN: I really have to get going. Bye.
DK: Jeg bliver virkelig nød til at smutte. SES!

Standard: It matters not. This crystal is..
EN: It matters not. This crystal is..
DK: Det betyder intet. Denne krystal er-

Standard: I think it does! Are you watching me?
EN: I think it does! Are you watching me?
DK: Det synes jeg nu det gør! Overvåger du mig?

Standard: I am but a helpful guide on your journey. Here to explain how to navigate THE TOWER.
EN: I am but a helpful guide on your journey. Here to explain how to navigate THE TOWER.
DK: Jeg er blot en hjælpsom guide på din rejse, til at forklare hvordan du navigerer TÅRNET.

Standard: That's creepy. Do you find yourself giving unsolicited advice to anyone who runs near this street?
EN: That's creepy. Do you find yourself giving unsolicited advice to anyone who runs near this street?
DK: Lidt klamt. Giver du tit uopfordret hjælp til hvem som helst der passerer den her gade?

Standard: Why do you seek the tower?
EN: Why do you seek the tower?

Standard: What's up with this crystal by the way? It warmed up when I ran past it!
EN: What's up with this crystal by the way? It warmed up when I ran past it!
DK: Hvad sker der med den her krystal forresten? Den blev varm da jeg løb forbi den!

Standard: I was about to explain when..
EN: I was about to explain when..
DK: Jeg skulle til at forklare det da-

Standard: Oop. I see the cops. Gotta go, creepy crystal voice!
EN: Oop. I see the cops. Gotta go, creepy crystal voice!
DK: Hovsa! Jeg kan se strisserne. Smutter nu. Ses klamme krystal stemme!

Standard: For once the city actually seems..
EN: For once the city actually seems..
DK: For en gangs skyld virker byen faktisk…
Handler alt sammen om ens perspektiv.

Standard: Is that a village down there?
EN: Is that a village down there?

Standard: ..I thought we were the only humans remaining.
EN: ..I thought we were the only humans remaining.
DK: … Jeg troede vi var de eneste mennesker tilbage.

Standard: Everyone in the city.. We’ve been afraid of this big, completely abandoned tower.
EN: Everyone in the city.. We’ve been afraid of this big, completely abandoned tower.
DK: Alle i den her by… Vi har været bange for det her store, totalt forladte tårn.

Standard: The police force was established to keep us safe from the wrath of.. No one..
EN: The police force was established to keep us safe from the wrath of.. No one..
DK: Politiet blev etableret for at beskytte os imod… ingen.

Standard: I’m not saying you’re idiots but..
EN: I’m not saying you’re idiots but..
DK: Jeg siger ikke i er nogen fjolser, men…

Standard: When I grew up. My mom always told me that dreaming was fine. As long as you did something sensible with your life.
EN: When I grew up. My mom always told me that dreaming was fine. As long as you did something sensible with your life.
DK: Da jeg var lille. Sagde min mor at det var okay at drømme. Så længe man gjorde noget fornuftigt med sit liv.

Standard: There would always be time to reach for the stars. Just get a good education. A good job.
EN: There would always be time to reach for the stars. Just get a good education. A good job.
DK: Der ville altid være tid til at række ud efter stjernene. Bare få en god uddannelse. Et godt arbejde.
Vent, hvad er det for en lyd?

Standard: I’m glad you are. That last level sucked..
EN: I’m glad you are. That last level sucked..
DK: Er jeg glad du er. Det sidste niveau suttede…

Standard: I know! What was up with those lasers!
EN: I know! What was up with those lasers!
DK: Ja ikke?! Hvad skete der lige med de der lasere!
Hør her, jeg beklager det der skete tidligere.

Standard: At least you can navigate around basic obstacles.
EN: At least you can navigate around basic obstacles.
DK: I det mindste kan du navigere dig omkring basale forhindringer.

Standard: Yeah.. The members of the force aren't exactly society’s brightest..
EN: Yeah.. The members of the force aren't exactly society’s brightest..
DK: Tja, de andre medlemmer af politiet er ikke vitterligt samfundets smarteste.

Standard: You notice something weird about this tower?
EN: You notice something weird about this tower?
DK: Har du lagt mærke til noget underligt med det her tårn?

Standard: I guess whoever built this tower just filled it with death traps and went their merry way.
EN: I guess whoever built this tower just filled it with death traps and went their merry way.
DK: Jeg gætter på at hvem end der byggede tårnet, bare fyldte det med dødsfælder og gik deres vej.
Lad os finde ud af det!

Standard: Hello Zoe. Turn to go good the way.
EN: Hello Zoe. Turn to go good the way.
DK: Hej Zoé. Drej for at gå gode vejen

Standard: IDK KEVIN IM JUST ZOE HERE
EN: IDK KEVIN IM JUST ZOE HERE
DK: ANER DET IKKE, KEVIN, DET ER BARE MIG ZOÉ
